Reviews.Title: “A good base for sightseeing after an excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: simontrant
Reviews.Content: We spent three comfortable nights at the Dedeman. We arrived very early in the morning and the check-in was simple and quick. Our room was small but adequate and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom is, again, small but otherwise fine and the water piping hot. The staff are attentive and pleasant and breakfast is excellent. WiFi was good. We did not experience much of the hotel's other amenities as we were out sightseeing most of the day. Although the hotel is located rather a long way from most of the sights they are all within a taxi ride of around 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Unattractive hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarwanAyache
Reviews.Content: Nothing remebers you in Dedeman. the hotel needs a special character to make the clients think of visiting it again. We used to order everyday for the kettle and the complimentary hot drinks, the amenities are very poor, they used to put the minimum requirments like shampoo and bath jel for one person. no toothpaste and brush, no bathrobe, no shoe shine kit, a lot of missing compared to 5 stars hotel. the loby needs to be more decorated with plants, flowers center of attraction. I will accept it as 4 stars hotel and not 5.

Reviews.Title: “bad service - bad complain handling”
Reviews.Author: bbjoern
Reviews.Content: first of all I received a room next to the elevator, could not sleep the whole night,.. after promised to look for a new room,.. nothing happened, I had to ask again, I was asking after a Massage, one for the next day was organised,.. but next day no one knows anything about - after asking to check this - only the Info no Massage for the requested (and promised) time availible,.. but promised to check for next day - same again,.. only difference: my bath robe was missing - but after 20 min. I received a new one - all over all it looks like a very bad joke - but no one cares,...

Reviews.Title: “Can be better, but ok”
Reviews.Author: JungleCatUkraine
Reviews.Content: I have managed to book it at a rate of 95 euro per night. This is ok price for it. At reception it costs around 200... Rooms - i had standart one. Rather small but cozy. Very comfortable bed. I disliked the dirt...i asked for a smoking room but the ashtray was dirty, ash was all over the table and floor...at the bathroom i did not see any sign 'desinfected' and the bathroom seemed to be hot very clean... Wifi..that is another story- Yes they have it free in rooms, but the signal is very weak...i did hot managed to send an e-mail with no attachments for 10 min. And you have to log in at the web site of the hotel, so to login from phone is pretty impossible... breafast - overage but ok. Roof bar- great service and atmosphere, poor food. in general if u stay for 1 or 2 nights it is ok. Staff is very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - a little out the way - but ISTANBUL is AMAZING :-)”
Reviews.Author: MominRabbani
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here on a business/leisure trip for 5 days. Needed a 5* hotel, and Istanbul being considerably expensive for 5* accomodation this seemed a fair price and standard. Indeed it was. the staff were pleasant particularly the manager, who even joined us one night for a drink in our room and a chat. The room was Perfect, great view of the bospherous bridge. I am an explorer - so i did enjoyably walk from hotel through taksim square over the bridge and in to the old city and blue mosque bazaar region. this takes 30-40 mins. so a taxi might be better for most. This hotel is on the new city side. if i stayed again, i would shoose an old city side hotel, near blue mosque OR in taksim square, new city, its only 10-15 mins apart, over the bridge. All in all - of all the places i have EVER visited ISTANBUL ranks as high as either number 1 or 2, with Phuket being the other. Istanbul is amazing, so much culture and history in the old city, with all the modern cafes and resteaurants in the new city. The bazaar is amazing, the museum, the mosques and their architecture. Everything about Istanbul was great, thouroughly recommended destination. Hotel is perfect for business travellers. if you can - Visit a hotel called THE BEYTI restearuant, totally out the way, in a residential area, locals/taxi drivers may know it, the person we met on business took us there. ITS SPECIAL - they have a helipad, as all the hollywood stars, past and present kings/queens primeinsters, presidents, have all dined there, with photos throughout the reception - the WHOS WHO truly......FOOD amazing SERVICE unbelievable, they had like 3 waiters to our table of 3, a lighter out for my cigarette before the cigarette is even fully out the packet. Dont know what the bill was though - as we didnt pay :-) Momin

Reviews.Title: “Short but impressed stay”
Reviews.Author: Janver11
Reviews.Content: This was not yhe fisrst time I stay in Dedeman. I was already in 1988). Hotel is after that completely re-buid and have good accomodation. Also lobby Bar is OK as well the Roofbar and restaurant which is excellent. The aread which a lot of restaurants gives you the change to have good diners.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but will not stay again? Its not 5*”
Reviews.Author: TunbridgeWellsTrevor
Reviews.Content: It is not a 5* hotel. On the positive side, the staff are attentive and breakfast is extensive and good. But room was tired and very noisey. It needs decorating. The bed was very hard. There is terrible traffic outside 24 hours a day. Despite being on the 15th floor I heard the roar and car horns all night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Martin346
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights - both my colleague and I had excellent accommodation and the staff were really helpful indeed. Breakfast was extensive and would cater for all tastes; my colleague and i are opposite ends of the spectrum, so whether you like light - fruit ceral and yogurt or full on omelets, fried potatoes, meats cheese etc as well. You need a taxi to get to this hotel, but for us as business venue, it was fine. The Roof Bar is very relaxing. Typical prices for a business hotel so always advisable to walk out and try and find something cheaper. There is a Starbucks a minute away and the 'Astoria' shopping complex complete with cinema if you want your Western experience. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “The good bits make the bad bits really disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Heavenl1y
Reviews.Content: Slightly disappointing start in that we had to take a taxi to find the hotel. It's a fair walk from the nearest metro-bus stop, and a very long walk from the nearest metro station. That makes it difficult to access tourist-land unless you're prepared to pay taxi fares every journey. Service was faultless, from the doormen who whisked our luggage away from us, to the receptionists who had us checked-in in less than a minute, to the housekeeping staff who left the lift so we could use it. Hotel was clean, well maintained, comfortable, well-lit and really welcoming. Our room was very nicely presented, clean & tidy with working air conditioning, and an opening window. Only 1 extra pillow provided, but another was brought up to us within minutes of ringing reception. Breakfast at the weekend was served in the ballroom. Tables were very formal, not enough chairs to go round the tables (so we had to go in search of one), buffet display disorganised and scruffy, food looked like it had been dumped on plates, had to ask for coffee 3 times - very disappointed. Monday's breakfast, served in the gorgeous Turquaz Restaurant was completely different - clean, smooth, efficient, organised, calm - and an absolute pleasure to sit through. The rooftop bar is fantastic - great views over Istanbul, especially at night. Very pleasant atmosphere with gentlle jazz singer in the background. Drinks were very watered down though - another disappointment. The hotel is in a great location, with a great range of restaurants (and prices) in the area. The one night we ordered room service, we paid a ridiculous amount of money for the Dedeman special burger, which was very thin, very tasteless and very dry, and came on a huge plate - looking lonely all on its own (no accompaniments at all!). Great range of facilities within the hotel: the business centre was free to use, and we were given the password for the internet. Wireless internet is also freely available in rooms, once you've set up an account. Didn't use the pool & sauna, but they looked clean and well maintained. Hairdresser, dry cleaning, chocolate shop & wedding planners all on site; even socks available to buy in bedrooms! Check-out was fast and efficient. Bags taken off us as we left the lifts, and packed into a taxi while we were paying the bill. Slightly disappointed that we were charged for breakfast even though our rate was B&B, and we had to argue before they checked our booking. Sorted quite quickly, though no apology for the mistake. Really pleasant doormen waved us off, which ended our trip nicely. Overall, we'd stay again because the hotel is on the right side of Istanbul for us, and because the things that are good are very, very good. Might reconsider if we couldn't get a good rate though - not sure it's worth the 200 euros that they advertise. Certainly wouldn't use it as a tourist destination: there are better hotels that are better placed for accessing tourist Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ando Vai C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located for both business and touristic activities. Clean, good variety of choice for breakfast, nice and friendly personnel, and good internet connection included (that's VERY important for me). Good value for money overall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable reliable home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Inotech_A_Team
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure to visit. Efficient and friendly without being over the top. Would recommend to anyone that needs to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hodaaa
Reviews.Content: Actually I have been there some years ago and just remembered wonderful breakfast I have had there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in another part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sherry_riosa
Reviews.Content: we were there as part of the Trafalgar tour...Location is good, there's a supermarket 10 min walk from the hotel, a lot of restaurant beside the hotel property, if your up for a walk around 20 minutes to Cevahir Mall and there's also the Astoria which is i think is so much nearer from the hotel. I did not take the Metro station but there's plenty of taksi outside of the hotel. The service is good. They have a wide variety of food during breakfast, waiters and staff of the hotel are all very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, very good sport facilities”
Reviews.Author: LNEDO
Reviews.Content: I slept 5 nights in this hotel during my stay in Istanbul. It has all what do you expect from the hotel of this star level. There is always someone on the reception who really speaks English and this is very good advantage. Stuff is helpful, friendly. Room are clean, nice. Breakfast is very rich and everyone will find what he is looking for. By all the concept you will easily forget the hotel as it is same as many others of this level. What make it great and special is a 22,5 m long pool, gym with enough cardio equipment. So big pool is not so often in Turkey so it is really special and very good after long working time. The disadvantage of the hotel is that it is quiet far from the historical monuments of IST but it depend why do you go to IST. There is one place except the gym you shall visit - roof restaurant which offer very nice view on one of the IST bridges and there is and excellent food there. Internet connection for free in every room of course.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Manager Olcay Dogan gave outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mmss2010
Reviews.Content: Olcay Dogan the front desk manager went out of her way to make us feel comfortable during our stay at the Dedeman Hotel.she always was attentive to my needs and made sure that whatever I need would get done immediately.her staff are very helpfull.(doorman concierge and reception ) the room was very clean and the hotel as well. in general the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I have a very good memories while I was in Dedeman Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and I have a very good time there when ever I am inIstanbul to have business meeting.I have been in Dedeman Hotel several times .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RenadElsherif
Reviews.Content: During my stay in turkey , i was staying at dedeman hotel but i left it & went to another one in taksim because of dedeman place , really its location not suitable for me :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivan d
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near the 1st bridge on the European side of Istanbul, superb view from the rooftop bar and restaurant. Rooms are nice too for a reasonable price/quality balance. We enjoyed our stay there, I was also working and it is very convenient to most clients' location. Staff was really nice. Only reproach was the bed which was a bit firm for our taste.

Reviews.Title: “A good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Outsider222
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dedeman during a conference in October 2011 and found it a pleasant place to stay. The hotel room was well-appointed, the food was very good, and the conference facilities were excellent. Lifts are fast, and there are enough that you don't need to wait for long for an elevator.The hotel has a bank machine just around the corner from the dining room. I ate several meals in the rooftop restaurant, and the food was very good. The second time, eating by myself, the waiter recommended that I should try the Turkish food and I was very happy that I did so. The breakfast buffet, both during the conference and the regular buffet (I stayed an extra night, after the conference was over) was equally good, with a wide variety of food well presented and prepared. The staff were very accommodating and friendly, doing their best to meet any requests. It seems that the hotel does a lot of conference business and has a series of smaller workshop rooms as well as a large conference hall. I was told by other conference delegates that the swimming pool was very good but didn't have time for a swim myself, unfortunately. Getting to the hotel was a bit challenging. I took the airport bus to Taksim Square and then a taxi from Taksim Square, which seemed to take a roundabout route there. The hotel staff were very helpful in aiding the taxi driver in calculating the fare in Euros, as I didn't have any local currency on arrival, and also in giving the taxi driver my destination when I was leaving. However, the hotel seemed to be quite near to the Bosphorus, as it didn't take us long to get to the dock area from which we set off on a dinner cruise on the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price good location great sports facility”
Reviews.Author: Roger S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times it is a reasonably priced hotel in a good location . Rooms are adequate.. The real selling point is the swimming facility and gym which are really good (though you do need to use a swimming cap) . Additionally the roof bar is also very nice and the beer is expensive although not as bad as other hotels I have stayed in Istanbul. Starbucks and some nice reasonable restaurants lass than a 1 minute walk

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: brewgirlca
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice on a tour. First time on 14th floor was great. Second on 4th floor was not very good because right above outdoor air conditioning for entire building and it had no cover so very noisy. Avoid the 4th and 5th floors and you will be fine. No ear plugs at front desk. A nice downhill walk to Bosphorus but take a cab back. Plenty of local resteraunts to get some really fine traditional Turkish food. Do check out the local fish resteraunt a few doors west from hotel. Dedeman rooms were very clean, and spacious by European standards. The rooms had contemporary bathrooms and were well laid out. The beds were firm and very comfortable. The air conditioning was still very cold at low flow so you may have to shut it off during cold season. The hotel smorg was fabulous and well worth taking in. Plentiful food, well-prepared and the vegies were to die for. They had a well-stocked fridge and it was cold.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stop”
Reviews.Author: Bodiddles
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here as part of Trafalgar Tours and hit traffic during the transfer, but understandable in a city of over 17 million people. We found the rooms comfortable in spite hearing the "call to prayer" every morning. The "down hill" walk from the hotel to the Bosphorus was enjoyable...(we took a cab back) and the hotel is near bank machines, restaurants, Starbucks and a grocery store. The breakfast buffet was amazing with omelets made to order and the roof-top restaurant was a treat. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Having 2 computers and a printer to use in the business center was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Brit_abroad_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Trafalgar coach tour, firstly for 2 nights then a further 1 night at the end of the trip. Our first room, overlooking the front of the hotel was small with hard beds ( my wife had her first ever back problem after 1 night here), the second stay we had a larger room with a sitting area and two comfy chairs. Service at Reception was friendly and helpful. Noise was a problem - at 1 am loud conversation and laughing in the corridor for ages, followed by noisy sex in the adjoining room, followed by a succession of phone calls where we could clearly hear (but fortunately not understand!) both sides of the conversations. Then on the final night some kindly soul delighted in revving his/her static motorbike somewhere in the vicinity into the early hours. The downstairs restaurant was pleasant and the breakfast buffet was extensive and enjoyable. There are several simple restaurants close to the hotel, but we did treat ourselves to a meal at the top floor Sky Bar which was very nice, with good service and a city view - expensive by Turkish standards but OK aginst British datums - and Service charge was not automatically added which meant that we were were able to tip personally, not just have it charged to the room. I would not describe this hotel as 5 star, probably a medium 4 star. I note that Trafalgar is using a different hotel next year. The hotel is close to the main highway from the airport, but when we arrived on a saturday late afternoon, this road was gridlocked and it took about 90 mins for the transfer. Then if you were visting the Blue Mosque etc, you had to go back into the traffic - if visiting for sightseeing then a hotel in the vicinity of the main sights might save a lot of time stuck in heavy traffic.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronika F
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference at the Dedeman . We arrived before noon and were able to get into our room immediately. The reception staff was very professional and helpful. Rooms are standard but comfortable, The only thing is: cups were big in the breakfast, you feel like drink soup. And the last one: ROOF BAR IS EXCELLENT with a good wiev and service.

Reviews.Title: “5 star prices- 3 star quality”
Reviews.Author: farted
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was in the 100 - 120 euros/night price range, it would easily be good value for money. Given that our room was 280 euros a night, the Dedeman is simply a shameful disappointment. Overall, everything is average- things have a modern look, but the attempts to keep things new and shiny are limited- scuffs on the wall, tattered carpets. Average breakfast, despite the legions of staff, good luck getting served a coffee. Even money exchange appeared to be a challenge- 'we don't have enough turkish lira to change 50 euros'. Seriously? There are heaps of better hotel offering better value for money, and more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Emanuel P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful! Staff was extremely friendly and helpful! Fatih, our bellman was fantastic and provided first rate service! Definitely LOVED the rooftop bar! WOW! Would definitely stay here if I visit Istanbul again!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: heund
Reviews.Content: As part of a Trafalgar tour, we spent 2 nights here. On the positive side, the food was decent, especially the tapas in the roof top restaurant and the buffet breakfasts. The pool/jacuzzi/exercise room were very nice, and the location was convenient to the main highway to the airport. However, we arrived at 7 pm and found 'our room was not ready', so were given a handicap room - on a Sat night on a top floor - noise was significant from inside (a wedding) and out and we asked for a different room the next day - one floor lower, but outside noise still significant and there was a party in the next room - we called reception/security 4 times from 1 till 5 am and still the noise continued. Have never had 2 such sleepless nights in any hotel! One other point - seemingly no one spoke English on our check in - the next day we did find good English speakers at the reception desk. Also, the carpet in the rooms was stained and seemed dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the name.”
Reviews.Author: Oliver P
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a relaxed air and great staff. Rooms a bit on the small side but clean and comfortable with well stocked minibar etc. Roof bar staff, view , and dining all very good. Substantial breakfast excellent with a superb range of food.Spa and pool look very nice but I'll be saving for next time. Rooms at right side a bit noisy from A/C on roof below plus not very nice view of offices opposite. Avoid if posable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Rooftop Bar has to be seen to be believed.”
Reviews.Author: philpoole
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service and great rooftop bar!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “smelly room”
Reviews.Author: Medo_obaid
Reviews.Content: The exective room in floor 11 was very smelly esspecially the pillow and the covers. Throw booking.com I've got a clear confirmation from the Hotel that my room will be special veiw and special treatment as we were honymooners when I arrived to the hotel they gived me : - A very normal city view room instade of posphore view - very normal treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ali20134
Reviews.Content: If you would like to have back pains then please be my guest and visit this hotel to experience worn out beds which sink deep an have springs popping out..... And I am slim! Reception move us at 6pm after second reminder although we initally mentioned at 9am! to another standard room only to have the exact same problem and a bath which has plumbing issues. Complain again only this time they don't really give a dame! Customer service poor, bedrooms for 5 star poor, air con poor (outdated and very very slow response time), outdated furniture, poor breakfast, poor communication between staff, even poor deep tissue massage which should have been called soft tissue massage! Jacuzie in spa area was cold as ice! Poor location, And the list goes on and on. And what do we get for compensation ......... Nothing !!! What a shame only goof thing about this is the roof restaurant which is clearly out of place because this was very good. Never ever coming back here again even if they offer free night... Terrible!!!! Do your self a favour and avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “hoda.p”
Reviews.Author: poorabbas
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very good.The staff as very freindly.However didn't have water boiler.

Reviews.Title: “Bad luck or Bad Management?”
Reviews.Author: jcostan51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dedeman Hotel Istanbul for 1 night on 29 July and 2 nights from 9 Augâ€™11. The staff, overall, were friendly and helpful. However we thought the room quality was aging and below par for a 5 star (e.g. the air con performed poorly). However during our 2 night stay from 9 Aug, we experienced a plumbing problem of water flowing across the bathroom floor from the base of bath after using the vanity or shower. This problem appeared on the first evening after our first shower and about 20 minutes before we were due to go out. To the hotelâ€™s credit, a maintenance man attended within 10 minutes of our call to reception. Within 10 minutes he said the problem was fixed, wiped the floor and left. Upon our return at about 11 pm that night we noticed a new pool of water on the bathroom floor. The maintenance man attended again but said that the problem was not a simple fix and he couldnâ€™t repair it that night. We asked reception to relocate us to another room. They replied they were fully booked (all 264 std rooms?) and could not re-locate us. The next day, no one came to fix the problem, we were not offered another room and no one enquired if we still had the problem. As it was our last night in Turkey and didnâ€™t want to spend the day chasing this up, we managed ourselves around the problem with towels on the floor. As far as we know the problem may still exists in that room. Unfortunately, on this experience, we cannot recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, quiet, good quality”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nicely situated for business. The reception was a bit chaotic but very friendly. Explained all the hotel features to me and was escorted by a porter upstairs. Again very friendly. Room on the 4th floor faces the back and is super quiet, comfortable bed, desk and a small TV which is placed a bit out of the way for watching from bed. Bathroom with Tub, good amenities. A/C was working flawlessly and held the temperature very well, besides having 32 degrees outside. Did not have a chance to visit the restaurant and bar. But definitely will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel on the far side of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tadalf
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, big room and bathroom, nice amenities, excellent breakfast buffet, attentive but unobtrusive service. The location is a bit far from the center, about 10 TL taxi ride to Ortakoy, where good restaurants abound. They are also a few good restaurants around the vicinity, a bit pricey though. Over-all, an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: steve_o34438
Reviews.Content: My stay in Dedeman was fantastic! It was my first time in Istanbul, and being a foreigner completely unfamiliar with the city, I relied on help from the front desk staff and the concierge staff a great deal. They were extremely helpful and warm in all of my interactions with them! I have to say, the staff here was the best, most helpful staff I have ever encountered on my travels!! Really blew me away! I was offered the chance to upgrade to an executive room by a front desk agent, and WOW, am I glad that I did! For only 60 Euros more, I had access to the Executive Lounge all day, which was well worth it! I really felt like I was pampered the entire time, like a Sultan of old days!! The amenities in the room were great I must say as well! My time in this beautiful city was made only better by my experience in this hotel! The rooms were great, but surpassed only by the staff and how exceptional their service was the entire time!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Diantha7
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights in the Hotel Dedeman, Istanbul, Turkey. I was attending a Librarians' conference, and was booked into the hotel through the conference agency, as were about 75 others. I awoke the first morning, scratching and clawing and bitten all over. I reported this to the agency, who promised to talk to the hotel about changing the mattress, but the second night was so bad, that at 4am I went to the desk clerk and demanded a folding bed, which I used the rest of that night and the following night. I had over 100 bites! I visited a nearby pharmacy and got a cream and pills that helped enormously, but before I did that, I had a miserable 24 hours. When I returned the 2nd day, I asked to speak to the manager, who would not see me, and referred me to a young female flunky who rolled her eyes at me, and told me to show her my problem there in the lobby. Instead I promised them a review on Trip Advisor and Facebook! Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent organisation for our international meeting!”
Reviews.Author: poseidon31
Reviews.Content: We organised an international NATO meeting with 75 delegates from 20 different countries between 28th and 31st of March 2011 at the Dedeman Hotel Istanbul. We've used the hotel's ball room as the main conference room and two meeting rooms for the panels. The organisation, rooms, food, service and everything was perfect. Thanks to hotel's Group Sales Manager, F&B, Security and all the staff. Hope to have new meetings at Dedeman Hotel next years.

Reviews.Title: “The Dedeman was great and service spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: sigmund123456
Reviews.Content: Our family loved the Dedeman Istanbul. The rooms were wonderful, modern and clean and service terrific. Breakfast was wonderful. Our kids loved the pool and the gym was modern, clean and up to date. Cant think of a time where the service from the curb to the room was outstanding! Everyone from the porters, desk personal and everyone was wonderful. The concierge who's name was Gui Alaca was the best! Helpful in every way to make our stay terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Internet doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: Priambelenge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Dedeman a few times, and I found time and again that their Internet connection is unreliable, whether it's in the room, or in the lobby of the hotel. In addition, the rooms are worn out and small, but that's ok given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevecho
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dedeman Hotel while attending a Conference in Istanbul . The hotel is excellently located , with good easy access to most locations in Istanbul , either by car or taxi . The hotel staff were very helpful and the stay was a enjoyable one . The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was good . Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on Business to Istanbul .

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from the city center, single room was small...like business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chika925
Reviews.Content: Tiny room with bed, table, TV. If it is business use, may be OK. But if you consider a hotel to be a part of your precious travel experience, better search for other nicer hotel with a bit more budget. Have a safe and nice trip to Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel - far away from Old City & sights”
Reviews.Author: Robbo05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on two occassions In November 2010 for two nights each. Nice enough room and bathroom, great buffet breakfast. Front counter staff were helpful, free internet in business centre but arrange first at reception. About a $20 cab ride to the wonderful main sights in the Old City

Reviews.Title: “Dedeman Hotel - not a bad hotel but far from the sights.”
Reviews.Author: erwk05
Reviews.Content: This was the first night and last two nights of a two week turkey tour. Obviously Dedeman is the chain hotel used by tour companies within Turkey. I probably would not stay here again but only due to the distance from everything, in saying that a taxi to the old town/bazaar from the hotel is approx 20-25 TL or 8 TL to the tramway and 1.25TL each way on the tram. This hotel, I ranked number 4 of 9 hotels we stayed in throughout Turkey. The rooms were outfitted nicely (with the exception of the top couple of floors (saw a friends room) the breakfast was OK with decent coffee breads, yoghurt, fruit, salad and egg selection. We did not have dinner at this hotel, there was a pizza place around the corner called breads which was pretty decent. There were a decent selection of english speaking tv channels (inc. BBC entertainment) and the beds were quite comfortable, we had a view over the road on 4th floor which could be noisy if leaving the window open. the bathroom was stock standard with shower over bath setup. Breakfast 6/10 average Rooms 7/10 quite comfortable and new feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Please, do not book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: skinnylizzie
Reviews.Content: We have photographs to prove that this hotel does not deserve its 4 star creditation. The fridge was absolutely filthy, the air conditioning did not work, the furniture was old, scratched and stained. The noise from the building work in the hotel was horrendous. We were showered with building debris as we tried to sunbathe. The pool was a leisure centre open to the public who received "perks" we didn't. There was very little choice at breakfast we lived on bread, cheese and parsley salad. Other meals and snacks were very expensive. Having complained, the management admitted our stay was not up to "Turkish hospitality" and offered us a free ONE night stay. As if anyone would travel to this nightmare hotel for a free night!!!!! By the way it is a long way out of town and traffic is grid locked so taxis cost an absolute fortune! Please don't stay there!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished room, excellence in every area”
Reviews.Author: SteveBMidlands_UK
Reviews.Content: I must say that my room had just been refurbished and I was first to use it following the work so perhaps not all rooms are as good, but I found this hotel absolutely spot on. I arrived late at night, having been ripped off for 130 YTLS for the taxi, do not use the sharks in the airport, walk past them (car hire, bus transfers) and get a taxi outside it will cost lest than half. I digress, the check-in was efficient with a real warm welcome after a long journey. Rapid lifts to the 11th floor, bags carried for me into the room, this is typically Turkish service excellence, why can't London hotels come close? Room as you can see from the photos is as good as anywhere, better than most, spacious, spotless bathroom and shower. Large TV with some English channels too, always some sport, but I didn't stay in the room very long. Breakfast is the usual buffet style with more choice than anyone could wish for. In the evenings I used the rooftop bar for drinks and snacks, expensive by Turkish standards but no more than the rest of Istanbul, I found the restaurants on the shores of the Bosphoros equally expensive with a few exceptions. But the main reason for the rooftop bar is the views across Istanbul at night. To sum up, excellence in comfort and service at this hotel, oh and it has a pool and fitness suite but I didn't use them, too busy exploring after working all day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value business hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiredofchosingscreen
Reviews.Content: Dedeman delivers at a sensible price. Small but well found rooms, quite firm beds, not paticularly luxurious but comfortable. Excellent breakfast buffet and good service throughout the hotel. I have been impressed as a solid good value 4* style hotel. Well located for business but not one to be close to the main tourist sites. Spacious fitness centre, large pool and sauna plus plunge pool. whilst equipment in gym not the latest it ha everything anyone will need as well as a good free weights section.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, although not ideally located for tourism.”
Reviews.Author: HektorX
Reviews.Content: Staff pleasant, helpful and efficient . Breakfast, swimming pool and exercise room excellent. Room not large but pleasant, very clean, quite well furnished and decorated. Contrary to some previous reviews, the air conditioning worked well and was fully controllable. Conference facilities good. Free internet. Published room rates very high but I doubt that anyone pays them - I paid â‚¬85 per night for single occupancy of a double room. Lift scheduling system rather eccentric - seems to be designed to minimise the movement of lifts rather than for the convenience of passengers. Some building work going on but the disturbance was minimal. Located in a not very attractive business district, so perhaps not the best hotel for tourists, but taxis are cheap and plentiful, albeit often driven by cheerful maniacs (and none has rear seat belt anchor points).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for money”
Reviews.Author: socrates009
Reviews.Content: In 2008 Istanbul, nay Turkey, while eagerly awaiting revenues to increase from Tourism, was not quite ready for it. The attitude of shopkeepers, airline staff (Turkish Airlines) and staff at Dedeman wasn't quite welcoming. Certainly not the way we are used to being welcomed at ITC and Taj properties in India. The Hotel itself is a spic-and-span business hotel, offering quality facilities to a business traveller. The bar is well stocked. The breakfast (our only meal at the hotel) spread is a delightful one. The rooms, some of them were very spacious indeed. But having only two small elevators for a multi-storied hotel is a nightmare for those in the middle floors. It never stops on the way up. And its always full on the way down. Not having lift-keepers makes it worse. The main problems arise when one fails to comprehend the speech of the staff. If you ask them to repeat what they have said once, they comply, but not in am apologetic or polite manner. It is more a "how dare you". And that's not how all Turks are. Incompetence is rife (cards to the same rooms issued to multiple persons). Thankfully we spent most of our time outside and not in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best for budget travellor”
Reviews.Author: shail2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dedeman is situated in a posh locality and is very easily accessable with buses and taxis. the hotel was chosen for us by the travel company that organised our week long trip to Turkey. With a service level that is close to excellant we were made to feel highly welcome. The impression given by the hotel staff was as if they were waiting eagerly to serve us. The breakfast spread was exceptionally varied and indicative of the fact that the management had gone to great length to cater to all tastes and preferences. We came away with a distinct impression of Hotel Dedeman as one where you get great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: fahaduke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me as I was a delegate from UK to Turkey by a Councilate. It is far away from main attractions. From reception to bellboy very rude and not helpful. Outlook is good of this hotel and therefore please do not get impressed with it as I did initially. On top of it the thermostat though given in each room doesnt work and air conditioning according to manager was controlled centrally and therefore i couldnt change the roon temp as it was getting too hot for me and my wife. Advice given was to open the windown at 3 am in the morning. Other option was to pack up and relocate in another room which I accepted but to my surprise all of them were the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Business.... but that's it”
Reviews.Author: SoumiCPH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Dedeman before and decided to give it another try - the hotel has moved from a business hotel to a package hotel and this was reflected in the quality of service. I would not stay again at the hotel despite the location as for the money, there are many many better options around. The icing was the breakfast set-up which felt like sitting in a 2 star package hotel in Bangkok - forget about holding any breakfast meetings and the quality of food was poor.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Avrom
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay there make sure to get a renovated room

Reviews.Title: “Good for business meetings, not the most comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mgralnc
Reviews.Content: This hotel clearly was once a very nice establishment. The problem is that it is showing its age, and could use a head-to-toe makeover. The rooms are tiny, but that was not a problem for me when traveling solo for business. The bed was not comfortable, the towels were rough, and the shower only has a glass partition over half of the tub, resulting in soggy floors every day. When I got to my next destination I had to launder all of my clothes because they had a stale smell, like the hotel. The staff was very polite and knew just enough English to make for smooth sailing. Our week-long business meeting seemed to go very smoothly as well. I felt very well taken care of. The fitness center was one of the largest I've seen in a hotel, although the equipment is getting old. The pool was a great size for laps.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: paulscan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the dedeman before commencing our Trafalgar tour. The room was quite spacious and very clean. The bathroom was ok but as the shower screen was only a half screen it was difficult to prevent water going everwhere. Meals and drinks were quite expensive although there are a number of small restaurants nearby that are good value. We were surprised that there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room considering it was a 4 star hotel. However would stay there again if in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: O'Hearn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this Dedeman Hotel for 4 nights as part of a large tour group in September this year. The most notable feature of this hotel was the breath-taking arrogance and rudeness of the staff, quite the worst I have experienced in five trips to Europe in recent times. As we were travelling with a tour group we had no choice but to remain there but if we had we would have checked out after one night. If you are intending to travel to Istanbul for vacation, sight seeing etc also be warned about the location and prices. The Dedeman is in the middle of a business district and you are well away from such places as the Bosphorus and the old city. The bar and restaurant prices are also outrageous compared to local venues and there aren't many of them near the Deadman, as we re-christened this place. Sure, you can catch a taxi to the old city but that involves a fifteen + minute ride if you are lucky and there are no guarantees about that due to the horrendous Istanbul traffic. On one day it took us forty minutes from just near the Blue Mosque. We had stayed at the Orient Express Hotel in the old city for three nights before our tour commenced. The rooms and ammenities in this hotel were about 3* but were nevertheless clean and serviceable. Most noticeably the staff were efficient, very friendly and willing to help with the most trivial of our requests. Hotels such as the Orient Express are within easy walking distance of most of the Istanbul main attractions and about 1000 restaurants/cafes which also are much more fun than the pseudo sophistication of the Dedeman. I would advise anyone going to Istanbul for holidays to do a thorough review check of the Orient and/or similar hotels and to then make an alternative selection to the Dedeman after having done so.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: sid510
Reviews.Content: I was recently on holiday with my family and i must say that dedeman istanbul is fantastic. the breakfast is brilliant and you can enjoy swimming pool, sauna, jacuzzi and keep fit facilities. The concierge is very very helpful... PLEASE DO NOT READ OLD REVIEWS everything is up to date now. very clean with all facilities you need. I would recommend any one to go there 100%

Reviews.Title: “Not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Baxterdog8
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a business trip. Paid the extra for a larger room with either city or Bosporus view - certainly didn't get to see the Bosphorous. Room was in need of a refurb. Very shabby and tired looking, was clean I think but hard to tell with the age of everything. Bathroom was the same and choice of toiletries poor; the grip rail in the bath/shower came off in my hand on the last morning. Free wifi in room was hopeless, kept getting disconnected. Had a room on the 10th floor which was good as the Executive breakfast room was on the same floor and had a good choice and friendly staff. Reception staff were a bit useless. At check in the girl answered a phone call so it took her longer to check me in than her colleague who checked 2 people in whilst I was waiting. Didn't need this at 11.30 at night! Check out was worse, the guy barely spoke to me, didn't ask me to check the bill before I signed or anything. Good things were location as the office was a 10 minute walk away and the wake up calls were spot on every morning - though why they ring you twice when you picked up the first time is a puzzle. Good location if you need to be in the area, otherwise go for something nearer the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: CPTtravel
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel with helpful staff. The rooms are basic and many weren't refurbished yet, especially on higher floors so the hotel doesn't have a 5 star feel to it. It has a business centre which is in the marketing manager's office which is a bit uncomfortable. The location is good for business definitely not great for anything else, it's on a busy street and public transport is a good 20 - 30 minute's walk from the hotel. I would suggest another hotel closer to the old town if visiting Istanbul on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel (with 5 star prices)”
Reviews.Author: sinaasappelsap
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Dedeman Istanbul for three nights in February 2009. I had a double room on the 7th floor. Starting off, the lobby staff were generally friendly. All guests need to walk through a metal detector, but they generally let you pass whether or not you set off the alarm. The room was pretty basic: bed, desk, mini-bar, bathroom, basic television, no alarm clock, etc. The beds reminded me of a smaller version of what you would find in a US roadside motel (e.g. thin mattresses, comforter covers that you donâ€™t want to touch with your bare skin). The curtains were pretty shabby and they didnâ€™t even cover the entire window. Also, the walls were pretty thin; I heard a few muffled voices from other rooms. That said, the bathroom was probably the best part (although the quality of toiletries was also poor). The other hotel facilities were fine. Meeting rooms were adequate, restaurant staff were attentive, hotel bar was only â€œremarkably overpricedâ€� instead of â€œunbelievably overpricedâ€�. There was a fair amount of construction, so the rooftop bar was closed, and the building was covered withâ€¦ some sort of unsightly construction-related paneling. The location of the hotel was excellent for those who plan on staying in the hotel and using the facilities. For those who would like to leave the hotel and see some of the sights, restaurants, etcâ€¦ then the location is decidedly inconvenient (and it is off of most maps of Istanbul).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Erins_travels
Reviews.Content: I do not have a basis for comparison with other hotels in Istanbul but based on numerous stays at four and five star hotels for business in other cities I do not consider this hotel five star. The rooms are small (but adequate). The TV has many chanels but is small (14''). The front desk staff are friendly and fairly efficient. The bed is hard and a little uncomfortable. The room is adequately clean. It has a boutique hotel feel -- small lobby, no gift store. The second hand smoke everywhere is a big drag. The room was a little stuffy and when I tried to put on the aircon I was told that since it was only April and not yet hot outside it was not turned on yet so the room was warm and slightly uncomfortable. I believe the rate was around 230 USD a night. Overall it was an ok stay but not five star and slightly expensive for what you get.

HotelInfo.Name: Dedeman Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Yildiz Posta Caddesi, 50 | Esentepe, Istanbul 34394, Turkey
